contents.item: I love being able to see an un-written future.
I swear that girl was born with a pen in her hand, the moon in her hair and stars in her soul.
She wrote love with her smile and magic with her eyes.
You’re not a bad person, you’re just a little bit different and I’m a sucker for that.
It's a lonelything, protecting a breakable heart
contents.owner: Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild: Poems

contents.item: It’s not easy to write a poem about a poem.
moonlight disappears down the hillsmountains vanish into fogand i vanish into poetry.
You deserve the love your soul craves for.Don't settle.
i am changingand i am loving change.
What a strange world.  We trade our days for things.
contents.owner: Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild: Poems

contents.item: When she bites my lips,I see stars dancing right next to the sun.
The prettiest girls shine brightest in the dark.
Its dark and I’m reading my scars because our moments remind me of where I should be.
My atoms love you atoms, it’s chemistry.

contents.item: To love is to soar in the wild unexpectedly.
i know it all ends the same, but i was interested in seeing how you would break my heart.
oh, the heartbreakingly beautiful tender weight of being human.
i want so much to touch youwhere my hands cannot.

contents.item: Poems are difficult to silence.

through the rose glass window in their beautiful new home, you stare at the love you gave away.
love is myself in the mirror.i will see love every time.
She was everything real in a world of make-believe.

contents.item: We swallowed the chaos because we knew we didn't want to be ordinary.
i feel everything.i do not know how to un-feeland to not feelis to stop the sun.
the woman is rain,and when she falls,she is a monsoon.to love her is to drown.
It was her chaos that made her beautiful.
